revision.comment: (bot) add rhyme syllable count obtained from Rhymes: pages
revision.text: {{also|Yarm}} ==English== ===Pronunciation=== * {{rhymes|en|ɑː(ɹ)m|s=1}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|en|enm|ȝarmen}}, {{m|enm|ȝermen}}, from {{inh|en|ang|gyrman}}, {{m|ang|ġierman||to cry, mourn, cry out, roar, lament}}, from {{inh|en|gem-pro|*germijaną||to bleat}}, of unknown origin. Cognate with {{cog|sco|yirm||to whine, wail}}, dialectal {{cog|da|jærme||to lament, shriek}}, dialectal {{cog|no|jerme||to bleat}}, dialectal {{cog|sv|jarma||to lament, shriek}}, {{cog|is|jarma||to whine, complain, bleat}}. Compare {{cog|sq|jerm||to rave, be delirious}}. ====Verb==== {{en-verb}} # {{lb|en|UK|_|dialectal}} To [[cry out]]; make a loud, unpleasant [[noise]]; [[shriek]]; [[yell]]. # {{lb|en|UK|_|dialectal}} To [[scold]]; [[grumble]]. ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|en|enm|ȝarm}}, from {{m|enm|ȝarmen}}. ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|UK|_|dialectal}} An [[outcry]]; [[noise]]. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=amry|ARMY|Army|Mary|Mayr|Myra|army|mary}} ---- ==Tocharian B== ===Noun=== {{head|txb|noun}} # [[measure]], [[measurement]]
